sentences.english: Chuang-tzu's theory of man's nature, simplisy, is the base of his theory of cultivating virtues.
sentences.chinese: 莊子的人性素樸論是其德行修養觀的基石。

sentences.english: Naive gatehouse stand in bluestone steps, tile-roofed house with the door tall and echoes.
sentences.chinese: 素樸的門樓立在青石臺階上，同門內高大瓦房相呼應。

sentences.english: The pictures depicting the life of the prairie people are simple but touching.
sentences.chinese: 這些描繪草原人民生活的畫面都很素樸動人。

sentences.english: Zumthor's creations exuberate with a sense of natural minimalism.
sentences.chinese: 祖姆特作品一向充滿素樸自然的質感。

sentences.english: She dresses so plainly that she doesn't seem to be living in the same era with us.
sentences.chinese: 她的穿着素樸陳舊，不像活在這個時代的人。

sentences.english: This issue of jade carving simple simple, thickness varies, the modelling is anomalous.
sentences.chinese: 此期玉器簡單素樸，薄厚不一，造型不規則。

sentences.english: This advantage of local women, Tai Shi public write lovely simple.
sentences.chinese: 這種實利的鄉土女性，太史公寫得素樸可愛。

definition: to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to blend into one another/to blend together well
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
